content.body: I’d like to have an incubator call sometime soon about a proposal (BigInt Math). I’m looking at https://github.com/tc39/incubator-agendas/issues/20 and https://github.com/tc39/how-we-work/blob/master/incubator-calls.md, but I’m not sure how I would go about adding this to the agenda.
Normally incubator calls are decided at the end of a plenary meeting. You could always just reach out to Shu directly.

> <@robpalme:matrix.org> Normally incubator calls are decided at the end of a plenary meeting. You could always just reach out to Shu directly. 

Ah, so *that’s* what that was. Thanks; I’ll reach out.
content.formatted_body:
In reply to @robpalme:matrix.org
Normally incubator calls are decided at the end of a plenary meeting. You could always just reach out to Shu directly.
Ah, so that’s what that was. Thanks; I’ll reach out.

content.body: jschoi: incubator calls is really just sanctioned time between each plenary to quicken feedback the feedback loop in between meetings
content.formatted_body: jschoi: incubator calls is really just sanctioned time between each plenary to quicken feedback the feedback loop in between meetings

content.body: at the end of every meeting i try to suggest a list of proposals, mostly earlier stage, that might benefit from such a thing. champions can also ask to be added, of course
* jschoi: incubator calls is really just sanctioned time between each plenary to quicken the feedback loop in between meetings

content.body: the larger proposals might opt to have their own calls regularly, but for the rest of'em, having a dedicated time helps
for completeness, agendas and notes are posted https://github.com/tc39/incubator-agendas
though the way the incubator calls have evolved, the agendas are largely useless, since we've moved to single-topic calls
i'll try to remember to simplify the process before next meeting...
